intro: Jubaea torallyi, commonly known as the Toral Lychee, is a unique species of flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other well-known plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, thick, waxy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, spherical berry that turns red when mature, and it is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat.
